result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy L. PIESCHEL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).
  • Disorderly Conduct/use of dangerous weapon [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Only possess drugs that are lawfully prescribed to her, use only one doctor and one pharmacist for medications.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy L. PIESCHEL

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 10-21-2017.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Modifying Sentence.
It is ordered that the 90 day condition time imposed on 06-22-17 be stayed effective immediately, and the remaining 12 days can be imposed at the agent's discretion.
Copy delivered to jail.
Court Order and Waiver of Appearance granting the request made by the Department of Corrections for 90 days in jail conditional time, with Huber, starting 06-22-17.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The State files an Amended Information which adds count 2, disorderly conduct/use of dangerous weapon, contrary to Section 947.01(1) and 939.63(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST pleas entered to both count in the Amended Information.  Convicted.
On count 1, sentence is withheld and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC for three (3) years.
Conditions of probation:
1) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
2) Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or combination;
3) Maintain absolute sobriety;
4) Only possess drugs that are lawfully prescribed to her, use only one doctor and one pharmacist for medications;
5) Submit to random urine screens and pay for same;
6) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.
On count 2, the defendant is sentenced to six (6) months jail, consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served.
Court costs are waived on both counts.
Amended Information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 07-10-14 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-23-14 at 9:30 a.m.  Counsel have a stipulation to amend defendant's condition of bail to no assaultive contact with Myron Pieschel, Marissa Pieschel, Tanya Pivonka-Dewane, N.P.B., DOB: 01-31-13 and S.P.B., DOB: 03-20-14.  Court grants the amendment.   
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree reckless injury.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-07-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Myron Pieschel or the residence at 1213 S. 7th Street, Manitowoc, WI and Marissa Pieschel, Tanya Pivonka-Dewane, N.P.B., DOB: 01-31-13 and S.P.B., DOB: 03-20-14.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
